Inglewood (LA): California has bills like SB 1383 that diverts 75% of organic waste from landfills. There are facilities that capture landfill gas and converts it to renewable natural gas for heating and cooling.
Glendale (Pheonix): Most trash goes to landfills, but there are some recycling facilities.
Las Vegas: Most goes to a landfill called Apex Landfill, one of the largest in NA. It also has the largest recycling facility in NA. https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aHzltu6Tvl8
New Orleans: Infastructure for handling toxic waste is lacking in many areas of the city.
Santa Clara: Promotes composting and hierarchical disposal of trash. Pretty average/baseline.
Atlanta: Large portion of waste still goes to landfills and its recycling initiatives have a lot of issues.
Seattle: On-site MRFi sorting, 95–100% diversion on field projects
Cleveland: Food waste sent to anaerobic digester → biogas
Kansas City: Reusable cup system + biodigesters for food waste

New Orleans: Has a Net Zero by 2050 climate action
Cleveland: Yes – New domed Browns Stadium planned (2029)
Kansas City: Yes – Waste & compost upgrades tied to 2026 World Cup
